intro: Centaurea zimmermanniana, commonly known as the Zimmermann's cornflower, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features blue to purple flowers that bloom in summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and often branching. Centaurea zimmermanniana is often found in dry, sunny habitats such as rocky soils and grasslands.
